snippet: Thomas W. Libous, the State Senate’s second-highest-ranking Republican and an ally of the governor, was indicted along with his son, who was accused of filing false tax returns.
abstract: New York State Sen Thomas W Libous is indicted on charges that he lied to Federal Bureau of Investigation agents examining whether he had misused his office in order to obtain a job for his son Matthew; in a separate indictment, Matthew Libous is charged with filing false tax returns.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Joseph Berger and Susanne Craig contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Thomas W. Libous, the State Senate’s second-highest-ranking Republican and an ally of the governor, was indicted along with his son, who was accused of filing false tax returns.

headline.seo: State Senator Thomas Libous Is Indicted on Federal Charges
headline.main: G.O.P. Power Broker in Albany Accused of Lying to F.B.I.
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Power Broker in Albany Is Charged With Lying to F.B.I.
